newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes down against US dollar in Shanghai.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes down against US dollar in Shanghai.

text.p: The Chinese yuan ended down at 8.30 against the U.S. dollar on Monday from last Friday's 8.2980 partly due to intervention by the central bank on the Shanghai-based interbank foreign exchange market, dealers said.
The yuan opened slightly up at 8.2979. After hitting an intra-day high of 8.2978 early in the session, it consolidated down steadily, hitting a low of 8.3010.
Trading was active with most done at 8.30, traders said.
Dealers said the central bank's intervention capped the yuan as it did last Friday.
"There was a a lot of follow-up selling triggered by the intervention to push the yuan down further below 8.30," one dealer said.
"Today's falls indicate the consolidation around the 8.30 level will continue in the short term," a second dealer said.
Dealers expect the yuan to move around 8.30 on Tuesday.
The yuan closed up at 7.3501 from 7.3900 against 100 Japanese yen and slightly up to 1.0738 from 1.0749 against the Hong Kong dollar.
